description.narrative:
Oxfam IBIS har inkommit med en ansökan till Sida, enheten för Sydsudan, angående finansiellt stöd för genomförandet av projektet ‘Building resilience through gender and conflict sensitive approaches to education, skills development and sustainable livelihoods in South Sudan’ under perioden 2021-2025. Projektet har en total budget på 90 000 000 SEK, vilket också motsvarar Sidas totala, finansiella bidrag för genomförandet av projektet.
Den föreslagna insatsen ska genomföras i Juba, Pibor och Rumbek i Sydsudan och fokuserar på hållbar försörjning och utbildning, med fokus på de allra mest sårbara. Förslaget beaktar läs- och skrivkunnighet, tekniska färdigheter och yrkesutbildning, samt affärs- och livsfärdigheter, sammanlänkade med aktiviteter i syfte att öka hållbara försörjningsmöjligheter och stärkt motståndskraft hos befolkningen att på sikt hantera konflikt, kriser och katastrofer. Projektets aktiviteter kommer att genomföras med en genus- och konfliktkänslig lins och ta avstamp ur individers- och lokalsamhällens behov i Juba, Pibor och Rumbek.
Projektet förväntas bidra till följande mål och resultat:
Övergripande mål: Stärkt motståndskraft genom genus- och konfliktkänslig utbildning och kompetensbaserade lösningar för hållbar försörjning bland flickor, pojkar, kvinnor och män.
Resultat 1: Ungdomar, kvinnor och män påverkade av konflikt har förbättrad kunskap och färdigheter genom säker, kvalitets- och genuskänslig utbildning och kompetensutveckling.
Resultat 2: Stärkt inkluderat deltagande och genuskänsligt lokalt ledarskap för att säkerställa motståndskraftiga utbildningssystem och hållbar försörjning.
Insatsen kommer att genomföras av Oxfam IBIS i samarbete med Oxfam Great Britain (GB), Oxfam Sydsudan, samt implementerande partnerorganisationer på lokal nivå; National Education Coalition (NEC), Disabled Association for Rehabilitation and Development (DARD) och Serving and Learning Together (SALT). Sammantaget uppskattas att cirka 24% av den totala budgeten kommer att vidareförmedlas till implementerande partnerorganisationer.

Oxfam IBIS has applied to Sida for funding of USD 10 066 992 to carry out the proposed intervention "Building resilience through gender and conflict sensitive approaches to education, skills development and sustainable livelihoods in South Sudan". The intervention will be implemented in Juba, Pibor and Rumbek during the period 2021-2025.
The intervention's overall objective is to contribute to "Improved resilience through gender and conflict sensitive education and skill-based solutions for sustainable livelihoods among the target girls, boys, women and men". This will be achieved by the following outcomes:
- Outcome 1: Conflict-affected adolescents, youth, women and men have improved knowledge and skills through safe, quality and gender responsive education and skills development.
- Outcome 2: Strengthened inclusive participation and gender responsive local leadership to ensure resilient education systems and sustainable livelihoods.
Oxfam has developed a project proposal considering literacy, technical and vocational training, business and life skills training intertwined with activities to increase livelihood resilience, focusing on the most vulnerable. The activities will be carried out with a gender and conflict sensitive approach, based on the needs of individuals- and local communities.
Oxfam IBIS will implement the intervention together with Oxfam Great Britain (GB), Oxfam South Sudan and local implementing organisations; the National Education Coalition (NEC), Disabled Association for Rehabilitation and Development (DARD), and Serving and Learning Together (SALT). Approximately 24% of the total budget is estimated to be forwarded to implementing partners.

The overall objective of the intervention is "improved resilience through gender and conflict sensitive education and skill-based solutions for sustainable livelihoods among the target girls, boys, women and men in South Sudan".
This will be achieved through the following outcomes:
Outcome 1: Conflict-affected adolescents, youth, women and men have improved knowledge and skills through safe, quality and gender responsive education and skills development.
Output 1.1 Improved enrolment and completion of alternative education initiatives (ALP) cycles by learners
Output 1.2 Improved numeracy and literacy skills (including life and business skills) of youth and adults, with special focus on young and adult women
Output 1.3 Girls of Primary 6 to 8 classes supported to retain in school
Output 1.4 Improved technical skills (including life and business skills) for youth and adults, with special focus on young and adult women
Output 1.5 Improved well being of learners
Output 1.6 Established school gardens to improve nutrition and practical skills among learners.
Outcome 2: Strengthened inclusive participation and gender responsive local leadership to ensure resilient education systems and sustainable livelihoods.
Output 2.1 Improved capacity of local education authorities, School Management Committees (SMCs) and Parent Teacher Associations (PTAs) on school management and Community Managed Disaster Risk Reduction (CMDRR)
Output 2.2 Promoting and mobilizing communities and local leadership on positive gender behaviors to improve womens position in the community.
Output 2.3 Improved capacity of local civil society to support and advocate for the strengthening of resilient education systems.
Output 2.4 Improved capacity of teachers through tailored professional development, including Disaster Risk Reduction, gender and conflict sensitive education capacities.
Output 2.5 Improved agricultural production and livelihood through established and revitalized producer cooperatives, increased vegetable production and enhanced fish production
Output 2.6 Strengthened extension services to farmers and farmers training to ensure usage and adoption of suitable agronomic practices
Output 2.7 Established and supported village savings groups (VSGs)
Output 2.8 Increased goat production and income for pastoralist communities.

tag.narrative: 2.1 - By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants, to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round.

2.1 - Senast 2030 avskaffa hunger och garantera alla människor, i synnerhet de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer, inklusive små barn, tillgång till tillräckligt med säker och näringsrik mat året om.
4.6 - By 2030, ensure that all youth and a substantial proportion of adults, both men and women, achieve literacy and numeracy.
4.6 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla ungdomar och en väsentlig andel av alla vuxna – både män och kvinnor – lär sig läsa, skriva och räkna.
